document_data.name: Cassyt
document_data.race: [[Half-elf]]Cassyt is variably described as either a half-elf ("[[Dues for the Dead]]", p. 8; "[[Tyranny of Phlan]]", p. 19), or as a human ("Dues for the Dead", p. 21; "[[Black Heart of Vengeance]]", p. 34). This article assumes half-elf is the correct race, since that is what is most often repeated in prose.
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite adventurers league/Black Heart of Vengeance|19}}{{Cite adventurers league/Black Heart of Vengeance|34}}
document_data.alignment5e: [[Lawful good]]In Cassyt's earlier appearance in "Dues for the Dead" (p. 21), her alignment is given as [[neutral good]].
document_data.mainbody: '''Cassyt''' was a [[cleric]] of [[Kelemvor]] in [[Phlan]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: Cassyt's principal character trait was a sense of humor that was dry and a little warped. Once being sunny and talkative, she later demonstrated a grim determination.{{Cite adventurers league/Black Heart of Vengeance|30}}
document_data.Relationship: She was good friends with [[Aleyd Burral]].{{Cite adventurers league/Dues for the Dead|7-8}} Later she had dealings with the [[Order of the Gauntlet]]{{Cite adventurers league/Black Heart of Vengeance|19}}
